current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To improve procedures for the consideration
		  of legislation and nominations in the Senate.

cosponsor.#tail:
) submitted the following resolution;
			 which was considered and agreed to

text.#text:
A motion to proceed to the consideration of
			 a measure or matter made pursuant to this section shall be debatable for no
			 more than 4 hours, equally divided in the usual form. If the motion to proceed
			 is agreed to the following conditions shall apply:

header.#text:
Motion To
			 proceed and consideration of amendments

text.#text:
The first
			 amendments in order to the measure or matter shall be one first-degree
			 amendment each offered by the minority, the majority, the minority, and the
			 majority, in that order. If an amendment is not offered in its designated order
			 under this paragraph, the right to offer that amendment is forfeited.

If a cloture
			 motion has been filed pursuant to rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate
			 on a measure or matter proceeded to under this section, it shall not be in
			 order for the minority to propose its first amendment unless it has been
			 submitted to the Senate Journal Clerk by 1:00 p.m. on the day following the
			 filing of that cloture motion, for the majority to propose its first amendment
			 unless it has been submitted to the Senate Journal Clerk by 3:00 p.m. on the
			 day following the filing of that cloture motion, for the minority to propose
			 its second amendment unless it has been submitted to the Senate Journal Clerk
			 by 5:00 p.m. on the day following the filing of that cloture motion, or for the
			 majority to propose its second amendment unless it has been submitted to the
			 Senate Journal Clerk by 7:00 p.m. on the day following the filing of that
			 cloture motion. If an amendment is not timely submitted under this paragraph,
			 the right to offer that amendment is forfeited.

shall be disposed of before the next amendment in
			 order under

is not divisible or subject to amendment while
			 pending.

, if adopted, shall be considered original text for
			 purpose of further amendment.

text.#text:
No points of
			 order shall be waived by virtue of this section.

No motion to
			 commit or recommit shall be in order during the pendency of any amendment
			 offered pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
are
			 disposed of, any amendment in order under

but not actually
			 pending upon the expiration of post-cloture time may be offered and may be
			 debated for not to exceed 1 hour, equally divided in the usual form. Any
			 amendment offered under

that is ruled non-germane on a point of
			 order shall not fall upon that ruling, but instead shall remain pending and
			 shall require 60 votes in the affirmative to be agreed to.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding
			 rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate, if cloture is invoked on the
			 measure or matter before all amendments offered under

This section shall expire on the day after
			 the date of the sine die adjournment of the 113th Congress.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 there shall be no more than 8 hours of post-cloture consideration equally
			 divided in the usual form.

text.#text:
If cloture is invoked in accordance with rule XXII
			 of the Standing Rules of the Senate on a nomination described in

A nomination described in this paragraph is any
			 nomination except for the nomination of an individual—

to a position at
			 level I of the Executive Schedule under

to serve as a
			 judge or justice appointed to hold office during good behavior.

If cloture is invoked in accordance
			 with rule XXII of the Standing Rules of the Senate on a nomination of an
			 individual to serve as a judge of a district court of the United States, there
			 shall be no more than 2 hours of post-cloture consideration equally divided in
			 the usual form.

header.#text:
Special rule
			 for district court nominees

text.#text:
This section shall expire on the day after
			 the date of the sine die adjournment of the 113th Congress.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 15 ATS: To improve procedures for the consideration of legislation and nominations in the Senate.
